Abstract: The advent of Robo-Advice in the FinTech sector has marked a significant shift in the way households manage their finances, aiming to transform them into rational economic agents. This study explores the impact of Robo-Advice on household finance, focusing on its ability to mitigate behavioral biases in consumption, debt management, and investment decisions. By leveraging algorithms and data analytics, Robo-Advice offers personalized financial guidance, encouraging more informed and efficient financial behaviors. The research delves into the mechanisms through which Robo-Advice influences financial decision-making, highlighting its potential to enhance financial literacy and stability among households. Through a comprehensive analysis, this paper contributes to the understanding of how technology can bridge the gap between behavioral finance and optimal financial practices.
